definition: to deal a single fatal blow/(fig.) to totally repudiate sb because of a minor error
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
stick/rod/truncheon
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: It would be unfair, of course, to see all Chinese companies in this light.
sentences.chinese: 當然，一棍子打死所有中國企業的做法有失公平。

sentences.english: I feel ashamed that I carry a slight damn British accent…
sentences.chinese: 沒有一棍子打死全部人，我還是有自己喜歡的英國人。

sentences.english: Whenever you have a bright idea, the boss puts a stopper on it.
sentences.chinese: 你有一個好主意，老闆就一棍子打死。

sentences.english: Of respecting woman coquettish , the man is used to a knock sb. down at one stroke.
sentences.chinese: 說到女人的風騷，男人習慣一棍子打死。

definition: (lit.) to take a part for the whole/to generalize
lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
to lump different matters together (idiom)
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to bludgeon to death/(fig.) to defeat sb by publicly criticizing them
to demand perfection (idiom)
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to discuss sth on its own merits/to judge the matter as it stands
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
not distinguishing red-green or black-white (idiom)/not to distinguish between right and wrong
pinyin: bu4 wen4 qing1 hong2 zao4 bai2

definition: lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: unilateral/one-sided
to praise sb in a way that puts them at a disadvantage
extreme (usu. of thoughts, speech, circumstances)
